basicRecipe.title: Simple Pasta
basicRecipe.description: A quick and easy pasta dish perfect for weeknight dinners.

instructions.description: Boil water in a large pot and add salt.
Add pasta to the boiling water and cook according to package instructions.
In a separate pan, heat olive oil and sauté minced garlic until fragrant.
Add tomato sauce to the pan and simmer for 5 minutes.
Drain pasta and add to the sauce. Toss to combine.
Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve hot.

complexRecipe.title: Beef Wellington
complexRecipe.description: A classic British dish consisting of beef tenderloin wrapped in puff pastry.

instructions.description: Season the beef tenderloin with salt and pepper.
Heat olive oil in a pan and sear the beef on all sides until browned.
Remove the beef from the pan and let it cool. Brush with Dijon mustard.
Finely chop mushrooms and cook in the same pan until all moisture has evaporated.
Lay out prosciutto slices, spread the mushroom mixture on top, and place the beef in the center.
Wrap the beef with the prosciutto and mushroom mixture.
Roll out the puff pastry and wrap the beef in it, sealing the edges.
Beat the egg and brush the pastry with it.
Bake in a preheated oven at 200°C (390°F) for 40-45 minutes for medium-rare.
Let it rest for 10 minutes before slicing and serving.
